title: GET_DISTANCE_BETWEEN_COORDS
content:
0xF1B760881820C9520xF698765E// GetDistanceBetweenCoords
float GET_DISTANCE_BETWEEN_COORDS(float x1, float y1, float z1, float x2, float y2, float z2, BOOL useZ);Parameters:x1: The X coordinate of the first point.y1: The Y coordinate of the first point.z1: The Z coordinate of the first point.x2: The X coordinate of the second point.y2: The Y coordinate of the second point.z2: The Z coordinate of the second point.useZ: Whether or not to use the Z coordinate.Returns: The distance between the passed points in units.Returns the distance between two three-dimensional points, optionally ignoring the Z values.
If useZ is false, only the 2D plane (X-Y) will be considered for calculating the distance.
Consider using this faster native instead: SYSTEM::VDIST - DVIST always takes in consideration the 3D coordinates.Examples:LuaC#local dist = GetDistanceBetweenCoords(0.0, 0.0, 0.0, 5.0, 5.0, 5.0, true)

-- language faster equivalent:
local firstVec = vector3(0.0, 0.0, 0.0)
local secondVec = vector3(5.0, 5.0, 5.0)

local dist = #(firstVec - secondVec) -- Use Z
local dist = #(firstVec.xy - secondVec.xy) -- Do not use Z
codeBlocks:
// GetDistanceBetweenCoords
float GET_DISTANCE_BETWEEN_COORDS(float x1, float y1, float z1, float x2, float y2, float z2, BOOL useZ);

local dist = GetDistanceBetweenCoords(0.0, 0.0, 0.0, 5.0, 5.0, 5.0, true)

-- language faster equivalent:
local firstVec = vector3(0.0, 0.0, 0.0)
local secondVec = vector3(5.0, 5.0, 5.0)

local dist = #(firstVec - secondVec) -- Use Z
local dist = #(firstVec.xy - secondVec.xy) -- Do not use Z
